comment: Unless otherwise stated; signal x-sections are taken from https://hypernews.cern.ch/HyperNews/CMS/get/higgs/1738.html
in the [120;130] range they are taken from the YR4 SM 13TeV tab; i.e. they are N3LO QCD + NLO EW
while for other mass points they are taken from the YR4 BSM 13TeV tab; i.e. they are in NWA and without EWK corrections; see https://hypernews.cern.ch/HyperNews/CMS/get/higgs/1738/1/1/1.html

For ZH and ttH the BR is obtained as BR(H->ZZ->2L2X) = BR(H->4L) + BR(H->2L2q) + BR(H->ZZ*->2L2nu) * BR(H->2L2nu) / [ BR(H->ZZ*->2L2nu) + BR(H->WW*->2L2nu) ] where BR(H->4L) BR(H->2L2q) and BR(H->2L2nu) are taken from the YR3 Twikis.
For ZH and ttH the BR column also includes the gen filter efficiency (0.15038 for ZH and 0.1544 for ttH).
Xsec from https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/CMS/PhantomGeneratorCMS averaging grid and events with their errors
background samples for Z+X studies xsec cross section taken from https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/viewauth/CMS/SummaryTable1G25ns#DY_Z
#this does not work because the weight indices are different.  It would have to be implemented in LHEHandler.cc to pick up the LO (not NLO) PDF weights.  If you need this sample ask Heshy.
